projects.title: Oxfam Novib trailwalker 2011
projects.description: We as a team of four collected 3000 euros to be allowed to participate in the Oxfam Novib Trailwalker 2011, which meant walking a 100 kilometers within 24 hours. The money collected summed up to 447.000 euro and was used for educational projects in developing countries. All we got was sore feet and an overwhelming sense of accomplishment!

contributors.headline: Lecturer @ Wageningen University / Consultant @ Ministry of Defense / Business Owner @ Dutch Workshop

projects.title: Afghan Police Instruction Cards
projects.description:
For sustainable police training we developed a set of instruction cards for the Afghan Uniformed Police in Kunduz, Afghanistan. 

After three years of police training the Dutch would leave Afghanistan and hand over training to Afghan trainers. To aid them in their program, the Dutch training manual was translated to Dari and a set of instruction cards was made in cooperation with Afghan policemen and cadets.

The instruction cards are basic visual cards with a minimum of text to take limited literacy into account. The pictures used in the cards stage Afghan policemen and Afghan ways of operating. The cards will help policemen and instructors to continue training and operating after NATO troops have left Afghanistan.

After completion the project, the cards were handed over to the Afghan authorities in Kunduz and soon after the authorities announced the instruction cards as official training and operating materials. The cards were later in 2013 also added to the official Afghan police library.

The main successes of the acceptance and distribution of the cards were the result of inter-cultural cooperation. Afghan users were directly involved with the development and all Western display in the instruction cards was avoided. Several stages of testing and adaptation have led to the end product.

profile_positions.description:
Adviser and assistant to the brigade commander and the chief of staff of 11 Air Manoeuvre Brigade. 

Responsibilities:

•	Liaising with domestic and international contacts.
•	Organizing and facilitating meetings and business trips for the brigade commander and staff officers.
•	Administrative management of the brigade staff.
•	Project management for incidental and recurring projects.
•	Facility management for the brigade staff's infrastructure.
•	Employment of staff support members.
profile_positions.title: Chief Staff Support Cell at 11 Luchtmobiele Brigade

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

•	Practical implementation of the ministry's policies at operational level.
•	Advising the brigade commander about media & communication.
•	The brigade's internal and external communications.
•	Receiving and supporting visiting journalists.
•	Training personnel in interview techniques, media awareness, press relations and the use of social media.
•	Acting as spokesperson.
